description.narrative: This project focuses on the development of platforms that enable women to have a strong and more visible voice in the reconciliation between the West Bank and the Gaza Strip.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. # of females represented in committees pertaining to reconciliation efforts: 2. A Gender Strategy for female inclusion in reconciliation process is drafted and endorsed. 3. % of women perceive that their participation in the reconciliation process has increased. 4. % of women who feel that they have gained tools and have strengthened in their role as peace makers. 5. % of women who feel their work through the platform had an impact on decision makers & the reconciliation process 6. % of people surveyed who believe women should not participate in reconciliation process. 7. % of people surveyed that have seen or are familiar with the nationwide campaigns .

1. # of females represented in committees pertaining to reconciliation efforts: YES 2. A Gender Strategy for female inclusion in reconciliation process is drafted and endorsed. YES 3. % of women perceive that their participation in the reconciliation process has increased. 25% increase 4. % of women who feel that they have gained tools and have strengthened in their role as peace makers. 50\%increase 5. % of women who feel their work through the platform had an impact on decision makers & the reconciliation process. 20% increase 6. % of people surveyed who believe women should not participate in reconciliation process. 20% decrease 7. % of people surveyed that have seen or are familiar with the nationwide campaigns . 50%

- MIFTAH created 10 groups composed from about 254 (165 women and 89 men) activists, campaigners, political leaders and community key personalities from the West Bank and Gaza. The group members were selected based on a pre-set criteria MIFTAH created 10 groups composed of 254 men and women activists, campaigners, political leaders and community key personalities from the West Bank and Gaza. The group members were selected based on a pre-set criteria - Establishing SHUFUNA platform 254 members form Gaza, West Bank and Jerusalem. The groups are diversity included refugees, disabled, members marginalized area, and women affected by the split. - drafted SHUFUNA gender strategy for female inclusion in reconciliation process is drafted

1. A Gender Strategy for female inclusion in reconciliation process is endorsed. 2. Capacity building trainings for Shufuna platform members conducted. 3. Public initiatives in promoting womens role in decision making positions implemented 4. Documentary, spots and audio-visual info graphic produced and broadcasted 5. 8 TV shows to promote women participation in the decision making positions in the public and governmental institutions produced

1. MIFTAH endorsed the gender strategy by the Ministry of Women Affairs. 2. MIFTAH conducted 2 training sessions for 50 Shufuna members in the Gaza Strip on dialogue and debate, negotiations, mediation, networking and advocacy and influencing. Each training session was conducted for three days which provided the Platform members with applicable skills that they can utilize in implementing public initiatives. MIFTAH also conducted 3 virtual training sessions (3 days/ training session * 4 hours /day) for 60 members of the Platform in the West Bank on; negotiations and mediation, communication and dialogue, and advocacy and influencing. Each training session conducted with the participation of 20 members and focused on three topics. 3. MIFTAH organized bus trips- “Reconciliation Bus” for a full day in the West Bank and the Gaza Strip. The bus visited political leaders and secretaries of political parties, Minister of women Affairs, Prime minister’s Office, members of the PLO, areas affected by the 2014 aggression on Gaza. 4. MIFTAH and Wattan TV with the support of the Shufuna platform members documented, produced and broadcasted the “Reconciliation Bus” trips including the different interviews conducted during the bus trip. MIFTAH also produced an audio visual info-graphic of the facts and figures included in the Shufuna Strategy which was also broadcasted. 5. WATTAN TV and in coordination with MIFTAH produced 8 TV shows on the importance of women participation and involvement in the reconciliation process. In addition, the shows targeted public and governmental figures to held them accountable to increasing women participation and representation in their institutions. Shufuna platform members also took place during the shows.
